name: Historic Center of Trujillo
description: The colonial heart of Trujillo, featuring historic mansions, churches, and the iconic Plaza de Armas.

name: Huaca del Sol and Huaca de la Luna
description: An impressive archaeological site of the Moche culture, featuring well-preserved murals and a nearby museum.

name: Chan Chan
description: The largest adobe city in the Americas, once the capital of the Chimú kingdom.

name: El Brujo Archaeological Complex
address: Magdalena de Cao, Magdalena de Cao, 13750
description: A ceremonial site with over 5,000 years of history, where the mummy of the Lady of Cao was discovered.

name: Huanchaco
description: A coastal town famous for its caballitos de totora, great for surfing and enjoying seafood cuisine.

name: Laguna de Conache
description: A natural oasis with unique biodiversity, perfect for relaxation and outdoor activities.

name: Garden of the Senses
address: Carretera Industrial Km 3.5, Trujillo, La Libertad Region, 13007
description: A space designed to stimulate the senses, especially for individuals with visual impairments.

name: Pacasmayo
description: A charming coastal town featuring colonial mansions and a seafood-rich culinary tradition.
